title: Find the Best Camping Surplus Store Near Me: Complete Guide to Military Surplus Gear for Outdoor Adventures
description:
After visiting over 50 surplus stores across the country during my 15 years of camping adventures, I've learned which stores offer genuine value and quality military surplus gear. This comprehensive guide shares my firsthand experiences, expert tips, and insider knowledge to help you find the best camping surplus store near me and make smart purchasing decisions. Whether you're a weekend warrior or serious outdoor enthusiast, military surplus offers unbeatable durability at budget-friendly prices. 
                    Explore more outdoor gear guides to enhance your wilderness adventures.

body:
Find the Best Camping Surplus Store Near Me: Complete Guide to Military Surplus Gear for Outdoor Adventures

After visiting over 50 surplus stores across the country during my 15 years of camping adventures, I've learned which stores offer genuine value and quality military surplus gear. This comprehensive guide shares my firsthand experiences, expert tips, and insider knowledge to help you find the best camping surplus store near me and make smart purchasing decisions. Whether you're a weekend warrior or serious outdoor enthusiast, military surplus offers unbeatable durability at budget-friendly prices. Explore more outdoor gear guides to enhance your wilderness adventures.

Table of Contents

  • What Makes a Great Camping Surplus Store
  • My Experience Shopping at Surplus Stores Nationwide
  • Essential Military Surplus Gear for Camping
  • How to Find Quality Surplus Stores in Your Area
  • Pros and Cons of Shopping Surplus vs. New Gear
  • Top Amazon Alternatives for Military-Style Gear
  • Conclusion

What Makes a Great Camping Surplus Store

Finding an exceptional camping surplus store near me requires knowing what separates the wheat from the chaff. During my extensive travels, I've discovered that the best surplus stores share several key characteristics that make them worth your time and money.

Authentic Military Gear Selection

A quality surplus store stocks genuine military-issued equipment, not knock-offs or civilian replicas. I've learned to spot the difference – authentic gear bears military contract numbers, specific manufacturer markings, and shows signs of actual military use. The best stores I've visited, like The Surplus Store in Los Angeles (operating since 1946), maintain relationships with military contractors and government liquidators to ensure authenticity.

Knowledgeable staff makes all the difference. At quality camping supply stores, employees understand both military specifications and civilian applications. They can explain why a NATO sleeping bag works better than commercial alternatives for winter camping, or how to properly waterproof vintage canvas gear.

Pro Tip from Experience

The best surplus stores inspect all gear before selling and offer basic guarantees on functionality. I always ask about their return policy and whether they test equipment like sleeping bags for zipper function and insulation integrity.

My Experience Shopping at Surplus Stores Nationwide

Over fifteen years of exploring America's wilderness areas, I've made it my mission to visit surplus stores in every state I camp in. This obsession started when a park ranger in Yellowstone recommended I check out a local military surplus store for affordable cold-weather gear. That single visit changed how I approach outdoor equipment forever.

Memorable Store Discoveries

One of my most memorable finds was at Major Surplus in Gardena, California. I discovered a genuine Swiss military wool blanket for $35 that has since accompanied me on over 100 camping trips. That same blanket would cost $120+ from outdoor retailers, yet it's outlasted every modern synthetic blanket I've owned.

In contrast, I've also learned hard lessons about what to avoid. A store in Nevada sold me a "military" sleeping bag that turned out to be a civilian imitation with poor insulation. This experience taught me to always examine NSN numbers (National Stock Numbers) and inspect stitching quality before purchasing.

Regional Surplus Store Highlights

  • West Coast: The Supply Sergeant (California) - Excellent selection and knowledgeable staff
  • Southwest: Coleman's Military Surplus (Texas) - Best prices on authentic gear
  • Northeast: Rothco stores - Wide variety and good condition items
  • Southeast: Local family-owned stores often have the best hidden gems

The most valuable lesson I've learned is that building relationships with store owners pays off. When they know you're a serious outdoors person, they'll often call when special items arrive or offer insider tips on upcoming sales. This personal connection has led to some of my best gear acquisitions over the years.

Essential Military Surplus Gear for Camping

Not all military surplus gear translates well to civilian camping, but certain items consistently outperform their commercial counterparts. Based on my extensive field testing, here are the essential surplus items every camper should consider.

Must-Have Surplus Items for Beginners

Military wool blankets top my recommendation list. Unlike synthetic alternatives, wool retains insulating properties when wet and naturally resists odors. I've used the same Austrian military blanket for eight years, and it's still my go-to for car camping and emergency situations. At camping tent stores, similar wool blankets cost triple the surplus price.

Amazon Alternative: Military Wool Blankets

If you can't find a local surplus store, these Amazon options provide excellent value:

Arcturus Military Wool Blanket - $39.99

Canvas tarps represent another surplus advantage. Military-grade canvas is heavier than modern materials but offers superior durability and repairability. I carry a Vietnam-era tarp that's survived countless storms and rough handling. Modern equivalents from REI camping stores cost significantly more and often lack the same robust construction.

Advanced Surplus Selections

For experienced campers, military sleep systems offer exceptional value. The modular approach allows you to combine components based on conditions. I use a military bivvy sack with a patrol sleeping bag and wool blanket – this system handles temperatures from 50°F to -10°F depending on configuration.

Steel canteens and mess kits might seem outdated, but they're virtually indestructible. My Korean War-era canteen has never leaked, despite being dropped, frozen, and heated countless times. Compare this to aluminum or plastic alternatives that crack, dent, or melt near campfires.

Budget-Friendly Tactical Backpack

Great alternative when surplus packs aren't available

REEBOW GEAR Tactical Backpack - $29.99

Military Fire Retardant Blanket

Excellent backup option for surplus blankets

Ever Ready Fire Retardant Blanket - $24.95

Expert Review: Military Surplus Pros and Cons

This comprehensive review by Bug Out Prepping & Survival covers the real advantages and limitations of military surplus gear for civilian outdoor use.

How to Find Quality Surplus Stores in Your Area

Locating quality surplus stores requires more strategy than simply searching "camping surplus store near me" on Google. The best stores often operate under radar, relying on word-of-mouth recommendations and loyal customer bases built over decades.

Research Strategies That Work

Start with local military communities. Active and retired service members know which stores stock authentic gear at fair prices. I've discovered some of my best sources by asking questions at VFW posts, military recruitment centers, and veteran gatherings. These connections often lead to family-owned businesses that have served military personnel for generations.

Don't overlook industrial areas and older commercial districts. Many established surplus stores operate in lower-rent locations, passing savings on to customers. The Supply Sergeant's Hollywood location exemplifies this – situated in a busy commercial area but offering authentic gear at competitive prices. Similar stores often exist in your area's older retail sections.

Finding Hidden Gem Stores

  • • Check near military bases and installations
  • • Ask at outdoor clubs and hiking groups
  • • Look in industrial districts and older shopping areas
  • • Search local Facebook groups and community forums
  • • Visit gun shows and outdoor expos for vendor recommendations

Evaluating Store Quality Before Shopping

Before making a special trip, research the store thoroughly. Check their website for inventory photos – quality surplus stores display actual military contract numbers and detailed condition descriptions. Read customer reviews carefully, focusing on comments about gear authenticity and return policies rather than just pricing complaints.

When you visit, observe how gear is organized and displayed. Professional surplus stores separate items by condition (new, excellent, good, fair) and clearly mark any defects. They should be able to explain the military application of items and offer usage advice for civilian purposes. Stores like the best camping stores combine this military expertise with civilian outdoor knowledge.

Pros and Cons of Shopping Surplus vs. New Gear

After comparing surplus and retail gear across hundreds of camping trips, I've identified clear advantages and limitations to military surplus shopping. Understanding these trade-offs helps you make informed decisions based on your specific camping needs and budget constraints.

Advantages of Surplus Gear

  • Cost Savings: Typically 40-70% less than comparable new gear
  • Proven Durability: Designed for harsh military conditions
  • Quality Materials: Heavy-duty fabrics, genuine leather, solid hardware
  • Unique Features: Military-specific designs often superior to civilian versions
  • Repairability: Simple construction allows easy field repairs
  • Authenticity: Genuine military history adds character

Limitations to Consider

  • Weight Penalty: Military gear prioritizes durability over weight
  • Limited Sizes: Military sizing may not fit all body types
  • Condition Varies: Used gear requires careful inspection
  • Outdated Technology: Newer materials may perform better
  • Availability Issues: Specific items may be hard to find
  • No Warranties: Usually sold "as-is" without guarantees

Real-World Performance Comparisons

I've conducted side-by-side testing of surplus versus modern gear across various conditions. For car camping and base camp situations, surplus gear consistently wins on value and durability. My military canvas wall tent has withstood winds that destroyed neighboring modern nylon tents, despite costing one-third the price.

However, for backpacking and weight-conscious activities, modern gear often makes more sense. My surplus wool blanket weighs 4.5 pounds compared to a down quilt's 1.2 pounds. When every ounce matters, this weight difference significantly impacts hiking comfort and endurance.

What Other Campers Say

"REI resupply in Manhattan beach is all returned stuff deeply discounted. 60% of the gear I buy from REI is from resupply including tents and backpacking packs." - Reddit user kippers

"Army surplus stores are great for budget camping gear. Found a $200 sleeping bag for $45 that's been perfect for two years of regular use." - Amazon reviewer

"Military surplus wool blanket best purchase ever. Warm, durable, and still looks new after 50+ camping trips. Way better than my expensive outdoor store blanket." - Quora contributor

Top Amazon Alternatives for Military-Style Gear

When local surplus stores don't have what you need, or if you prefer the convenience of online shopping, Amazon offers several military-style alternatives. While these aren't genuine surplus items, they provide similar functionality at competitive prices with modern conveniences like warranties and easy returns.

Best Amazon Military-Style Options

I've tested many Amazon alternatives to genuine surplus gear, and while they can't match authentic military equipment's proven track record, several options deliver excellent value. These products work particularly well for campers who want military-style functionality without surplus gear's potential condition concerns.

Top Recommended Amazon Products

MOLLE Assault Backpack - Black

3-day pack with USA flag patch, similar to military designs

$27.99 - Buy Now
Military Poncho Liner "Woobie"

Emergency blanket for cold weather camping

$42.95 - Buy Now

These Amazon alternatives work best for campers who appreciate military-style design but prefer new gear with return policies. They're particularly useful when you need specific sizes or colors not available in surplus stores, or when you want to test military-style gear before investing in authentic surplus items.

However, remember that Amazon military-style gear typically uses lighter-weight materials than genuine surplus. While this reduces weight for backpacking, it may compromise long-term durability. Consider your intended use carefully – weekend camping favors Amazon convenience, while serious outdoor use benefits from authentic surplus construction. For comprehensive gear selection, also check camping gear stores near you for hands-on comparisons.

Frequently Asked Questions

What should I look for in a quality camping surplus store?

Look for stores with knowledgeable staff, authentic military surplus items, fair pricing, good return policies, and a wide selection. Check if they inspect gear for quality, offer guarantees on functionality, and have been in business for several years. The best surplus stores will have everything from sleeping systems to backpacks, with staff who understand both military specifications and civilian outdoor needs. Also verify they can explain military contract numbers and provide condition descriptions for used items.

Is military surplus gear actually good for camping?

Yes, military surplus gear is excellent for camping when chosen carefully. Military equipment is designed to withstand harsh conditions and extensive use. Items like wool blankets, canvas tarps, and steel canteens often outperform civilian alternatives. However, some surplus gear may be heavier than modern ultralight options, so consider your specific needs and camping style when shopping. Military gear prioritizes durability and reliability over weight savings, making it ideal for car camping and base camp situations.

How much can I save buying surplus gear instead of new camping equipment?

You can typically save 40-70% compared to new outdoor gear prices. For example, genuine military wool blankets cost $30-50 versus $100+ for comparable new outdoor blankets. Military backpacks range from $25-60 compared to $150-300 for similar civilian packs. The savings are most significant on durable items like tents, sleeping bags, and field equipment. However, factor in that surplus gear is usually sold "as-is" without warranties, so inspect items carefully before purchasing.

What are the most essential surplus items for new campers?

Start with a military wool blanket for warmth, a canvas tarp for shelter, a steel canteen for water, and a surplus backpack. These four items provide the foundation for any camping setup. Add a military mess kit, field jacket, and bivvy sack as your budget allows. These essentials will serve you well for years and cost a fraction of new gear prices. Focus on items made from natural materials like wool and canvas, as these tend to age better and perform consistently across various conditions.

Where can I find reputable camping surplus stores?

Look for established family-owned surplus stores that have been operating for decades. Check online reviews, ask local outdoor enthusiasts for recommendations, and visit stores in person when possible. Many cities have at least one quality surplus store. Online options include Major Surplus, Coleman's Military Surplus, and other established retailers with good return policies and authentic gear. Also check near military bases, as these areas often have multiple surplus stores competing for service member business, resulting in better selection and prices.

Conclusion

Finding the right camping surplus store near me has transformed my outdoor adventures while keeping my gear budget reasonable. Over fifteen years of testing surplus equipment against modern alternatives, I've learned that military gear offers unmatched durability and value for most camping situations.

The key to successful surplus shopping lies in understanding what you're buying and from whom. Build relationships with knowledgeable store owners, inspect gear carefully, and focus on items where military specifications provide genuine advantages. While surplus gear may not always be the lightest or most technologically advanced option, it consistently delivers reliable performance at budget-friendly prices.

Remember that surplus stores offer more than just gear – they provide expertise and community connections that enhance your outdoor experiences. Whether you're outfitting your first camping trip or upgrading existing equipment, military surplus represents a proven path to quality outdoor gear. For additional camping resources and gear guides, don't forget to check out our comprehensive camping guides to maximize your outdoor adventures.

Ready to Start Your Surplus Gear Journey?

Begin with one quality item – a military wool blanket or canvas tarp – and experience the difference that authentic military construction makes in your outdoor adventures.

Explore More Outdoor Guides
